questions.question_text: In Spring'11 salesforce.com release Dynamic Dashboards have been launched for which edition:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The correct answers are:

A. Developer Edition
C. Enterprise Edition
D. Unlimited Edition

Explanation:

Dynamic Dashboards, introduced in the Salesforce Spring ‘11 release, allow users to create dashboards that display data based on the logged-in user’s access and permissions. They eliminate the need to create separate dashboards for different users or roles.

Dynamic Dashboards are available in the following editions:
 • Developer Edition
 • Enterprise Edition
 • Unlimited Edition

Incorrect Option:
 • B. Professional Edition: Dynamic Dashboards are not available in the Professional Edition unless additional customization or upgrades are purchased.
It is also available for performance edition

comments.content: Currently dynamic dashboards are also available in Unlimited and Developer editions.

questions.question_text: You can share the Dashboard components snapshot with everyone in the Company with chatter?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Yes we can share, but only people having access to the dashboard will be able to see the data

Explanation:

In Salesforce, you can share a snapshot of a dashboard component in Chatter. However, the visibility of the underlying data depends on the recipient’s access to the dashboard and its source reports.
 • Users who have access to the dashboard can see the data when they view the shared snapshot.
 • Users who do not have access to the dashboard will not see the data but will still see the shared post in Chatter.

This ensures that Salesforce respects the organization’s security and sharing settings.

The answer is D.

IMPORTANT Posting a snapshot to a user or group feed makes it potentially visible to the entire organization:
Posting to a user feed makes the snapshot public. Anyone who views that user's profile can see it.
Posting to a public group makes the snapshot public. Anyone who views your profile or the group feed can see it.
Posting to a private group shows the snapshot to all group members.
People can see it whether they have access to the dashboard or not. Make sure the component doesn't contain sensitive information!

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.dashboards_post_snapshots.htm&type=5

questions.question_text: Inline Editing is available in visual force pages?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. True

Explanation:

Inline editing is available in Visualforce pages, but it must be explicitly enabled and implemented by the developer. Salesforce provides support for inline editing in Visualforce by using the <apex:inlineEditSupport> component. This allows fields to be edited directly on the page without requiring a full page reload.

However, it requires:
 1. Proper configuration and inclusion of the apex:inlineEditSupport component in the Visualforce page.
 2. Fields to be inline-editable based on user permissions and record access.

If not implemented or configured, inline editing will not work by default.

B. False
Inline editing is generally not natively available in Visualforce pages in Salesforce. Visualforce pages are custom pages that allow for a high degree of customization and control over the user interface, but they do not automatically include some of the standard Salesforce features like inline editing. This functionality can be achieved in Visualforce pages, but it requires custom development using JavaScript or other methods to enable inline editing capabilities. Therefore, by default, inline editing is not available in Visualforce pages without additional customization.
